author: chfast
content: For the reference, execution-spec-tests are filling blocks with invalid transactions with the expectation that the whole block is rejected during testing.

author: holiman
content: That seems to be based on a flawed thinking... The block can be rejected for many reasons. Maybe the tx is (erroneously)  accepted by the client but the resulting state root doesn't match whatever the block-builder stuffed into the block.

author: holiman
content: So that must lead to false negatives
